page.title: 16THE BEAUPRE CONNECTION
page.content: {THE BEAUPRE CONNECTION { The name Beaupre derives from the family Beaupre who built a large manor house in Outwell shortly after 1500. The house which was mainly brick built was substantially enlarged by the Bells who were the successors to the Beaupres. Despite its architectural value the house was demolished in 1966 but the name lives on locally; hence the naming of Beaupre Community Primary School (built 1939), Beaupre Hall Grouped Home (built 1973> and Beaupre Avenue (1966/7)which was built around the site of the house. Beaupre Hall Farm still survives and is an early 17th century building with stepped gables, much modernised. A painting of the Hall appears on one side of the village sign with a painting of the aqueduct on the other.
